questions.question_text:
A customer wants to import the previous 10 years of customer purchase data in their Marketing Cloud account. Through discovery, it is determined there are over
200 million records they plan to upload via the REST API, and this volume will continue to grow as the current purchase data is added.
Which two questions should be asked for further discovery? (Choose two.)

choices.B: How many API calls are included in their License?
choices.D: Does their License include support for REST APIs?
choices.A: Does their License include the Large Data Extensions feature?
choices.C: Why do they require 10 years of historical data in Marketing Cloud?

discussion.content: The Basic license DOES NOT include API Calls. so D is the first question you should ask the customer. Then you will ask the customer B because the customer is trying to import 200 million records, and there are different limits to the number of API calls regardless of the edition ( pro, corporate, and enterprise).
CD, why 10 years of data is a good question to ask clients

comments.content:
There is no such feature called Large Data Extension Feature
Second: not all salesforce editions have REST API, and if there is daily limit of API calls

https://www.salesforce.com/content/dam/web/en_us/www/documents/pricing/mc_email_journey_pricing_sheet.pdf
as far as I see not all editions support

discussion.content: I think B and C. All license type support API. never heard about Large Data Extensions feature and cant Found in google search
Think the right ones are B and D
It's weird, I have never heard about Large Data Extensions feature and MC supposes to have REST API for work

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants to find ways to better drive return on investment and growth via their marketing sends. They plan to centralize their analytics data to allow for a more efficient analysis of this data across all of their campaigns. NTO currently has Marketing Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Amazon Redshift.
What product would help their use case?

A consultant explains how a sending domain differs from a customer's primary domain. The customer is evaluating their options around configuring their domain.
Which two questions should their IT team be asked? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Are they able to modify their domain configuration's DNS entries?
choices.C: Will they be able to post Marketing Cloud-provided DNS files when self-hosting?
choices.B: Does their company allow delegation of subdomains to third parties?
choices.A: Can they provide access for Marketing Cloud to update the DNS records?

questions.question_text:
A customer is creating a re-engagement campaign. The campaign only targets subscribers who have had emails fail at send time due to held status within the last
60 days. The goal is to send an SMS to the subscribers asking them if they want to update their email address.
What should a consultant recommend to meet the criteria?

choices.B: Use Tracking Extract, File Transfer, and Import activities from Automation Studio to inject the subscribers into a data extension used as an Entry Source by Journey Builder.
choices.A: Use SQL Query and File Transfer activities from Automation Studio to inject the subscribers into an API Event used as an Entry Source by Journey Builder.
choices.D: Use Data Extension Extract and Import activities from Automation Studio to inject the subscriber into a CloudPage used as an Entry Source by Journey Builder.
choices.C: Use SQL Query and Import activities from Automation Studio to inject the subscribers into a data extension used as an Entry Source by Journey Builder.

choices.B: Create an exclusion data extension populated with the identified subscribers.
choices.C: Create a suppression list populated with the identified subscribers.
choices.A: Query all subscribers from the Sent Data View when creating the send.
choices.D: Import the identified subscribers into a list when creating the send.

discussion.content:
I think it's A. Query all subscribers from the Sent Data View when creating the send.
This query can be used within the exclusion script for email send and filter subscribers by send date.

These is a similar approach: https://www.marketingcloud.guru/managing-email-send-frequency-in-sfmc-65b9fe86ba69
Maybe A is fine, if you need a query to automate
B is better where we can update the exclusion data extension by querying every time before a send

questions.question_text:
A customer wants to limit the number of emails a subscriber receives to a maximum of one email every 14 days. After the 14-day period, the subscriber is eligible to receive the next message.
What should a consultant recommend to meet these criteria?
